Congratulations on creating your account! As a thank you, in addition to the Heroes, cards, and other rewards, you also get a pre-constructed deck.

You can use this to start your adventures right away -- simply select PLAY to begin!
If you want to customize your own deck first, select DECKS to learn more about deck building.
The username has existed. Please try another one.

Confirmation Window

Are you sure you want to skip the tutorial for now? you will receive a reward after you complete this tutorial.

You can also replay the tutorial at any time through the option menu.
Select Any Cards You Wish To Change
This will replace the current Attachment. Are you sure?
Please select a self card to quick strike an enemy
Raise your Threat by 1 for each Ally you control
Choose One Hero to Avoid Spider Traps
Resolve this Objective to complete the Quest.
Your last Hero falls, bringing your journey to a tragic end.
You draw Sauron's full attention, bringing your journey to a tragic end.

Samwise Gamgee is Frodo’s most faithful friend. Though he comes from humble beginnings, Sam rises to any challenge with unmatched bravery and determination.
The Faithful Servant pack is tailor-made for cleverness. These cards help you sneak past the watchful Eye of Sauron to claim victory through daring and stealth.

Faramir does not seek glory in danger without purpose. Touched by the wisdom and sadness of the Elder Race, he is shrewd in battle.
The Rangers of Gondor pack gives you the abilities needed to outlast Sauron’s forces and stand victorious at the battle’s end.

Éowyn is renowned for her courage and compassion. Armed with inner strength as strong as tempered steel, she stands unflinching before even the greatest threats.
The Shieldmaiden of Rohan pack contains cards that protect and restore your party. No matter how numerous or mighty, no foe poses a worthy threat in the face of the iron will of the Rohan.

Legolas is unmatched in his prowess as an archer. Gifted with acute senses and breathtaking agility, he often outmaneuvers and defeats foes before they even see him coming.
The Prince of Mirkwood pack taps into the strengths of the Elves: employing wits and swiftness over brute strength to strike down enemies with deadly accuracy.
To equip this Attachment, select a highlighted Character.

The first Campaign in The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game.

This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove.
You are carrying a message from King Brand to Grimbeorn through Mirkwood Forest.
You awaken to find that giant spiders have captured your friends.
After escaping giant spiders, you find yourself lost in the vastness of Mirkwood.
You have found the mighty Anduin but you must still journey downriver to Grimbeorn.
You reach the Carrock only to discover that Grimbeorn has been captured by Trolls!

The King of Dale has entrusted you with an urgent letter for Grimbeorn the Old, chieftain of the Beornings that dwell in the Anduin Vale. To reach his house you must journey through the shadowy forest of Mirkwood. Not long after entering the forest, you are surrounded by evil creatures.

You are traveling deeper into Mirkwood along an overgrown trail when giant spiders ambush your party. They wrap one of your friends in a silken cocoon with horrifying speed, then drag their captive off to be devoured. You cannot abandon your companion to such a fate.
You have rescued your friend, but you quickly decide that your only chance of escape is to fight your way out. You turn to face the swarm of spiders and begin your assault!
You have rescued your friend, but the spiders of Mirkwood continue to swarm around you. Realizing you are in danger of being overwhelmed, you decide to make a run for it!

Though you have escaped the spiders—at least for now—you find yourself far from the main trail. Searching tirelessly, you at last spy the path on the far side of a dark, unnatural-looking stream. As you look for a place to ford, a giant creature emerges from the underbrush to attack!

Having traveled deep into Mirkwood on the mission to find Grimbeorn, your party camps for the night. You wake from a troubled sleep to find yourself very much alone. What you thought was but a dream—the sound of countless legs scuttling around your camp and hundreds of bulbous eyes peering from the dark—was all too real. The giant spiders of Mirkwood have carried off your friends while you slept. It is now up to you to rescue them!

Searching through the night, you find your friends being held within a dark glade, surrounded by giant spider webs. They have been bound in cocoons made of strong webbed cords. They beg you to cut them free, but before you can try the spiders descend from the trees to attack you.

You've managed to cut your companions loose, but the spiders are determined to recapture you. They spin giant webs from tree to tree, trapping you in their den. You will have to cut your way through them in order to escape.

You hack through the spiders’ webs but advance only a short distance when an enormous spider appears, blocking your escape! Her many offspring gather behind you, cutting off any retreat. There is no turning back. You must defeat Ungoliant's spawn.

You have escaped from the spiders’ dark colony, only to find yourself lost in the vastness of Mirkwood. The forest is so dark and tangled that it is impossible to know which direction to travel. You must find some landmarks to get your bearings.
A stream winds between the twisted roots of ancient trees that crowd the riverbank. Traveling this way is hard work. You wonder if you should continue or search for a better path.

A sea of green spreads for miles in all directions from your view atop a low hill. Scanning the horizon, you notice a faint trail of grey smoke rising in the distance. Do you head for the smoke, or do you keep searching for a path out of the forest?

At long last, the stream you have been following leads to a wide bog. You must be near the Anduin River vale—but reaching the mighty river requires crossing the swamp. Who knows what dangers lie in wait?
After a long, desperate search you find a trail at last. Though it is overgrown and littered with animal tracks, you believe this path leads to the Anduin vale.

Navigating toward the smoke as best you can through the dense forest, you find the remains of an old Woodmen village near the eaves of Mirkwood. Yet your relief is short-lived—the village is overrun with Orcs! As they spot your weary group, it becomes clear that you must fight to reach the Anduin vale.

Emerging from Mirkwood Forest, you continue your mission to deliver an urgent message to Grimbeorn. You make your way south along the Anduin River toward the land of the Beornings. As you approach the location of a small raft stashed on the riverbank, a fearsome Hill Troll emerges from behind a grouping of rocks, and attacks!

Having defeated the Troll, you board a raft and float downriver. You barely have time to catch your breath before more enemies emerge along the river bank in pursuit, harassing the small vessel as you attempt to navigate the river.
Ongoing harassment from your enemies forces your raft to the shore. You must confront their ambush head on. If you survive this attack, the rest of your journey down the Anduin should be clear.

The Anduin river has carried you south from the Forest Gate to the land of the Beornings, where you hope to deliver King Brand’s message to their chieftain, Grimbeorn. However, when you pull your raft to shore, the Beornings tell you that Grimbeorn was last seen roaming as a great bear toward the Carrock. To find him, you must continue south along the riverbank.
After a day spent following Grimbeorn's trail, you make a startling discovery: a group of Trolls has captured the great chieftain, and plans to eat him! You draw your weapons and rush to his rescue.

Once freed from his chains, Grimbeorn joins you in your battle against the Trolls. “A barrel of beer to the one who brings me a Troll’s head!” he roars while swinging a mighty blow at the nearest foe.
Welcome to The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game! Aragorn and Arwen are ambushed while traveling through Mirkwood Forest…
Aragorn and Arwen venture deeper into the forest…
Make your way through Mirkwood Forest.
Resolve "Cocoon" and rescue the captive Hero to allow travel.
Defeat each Enemy in play to allow travel.
Resolve "Find the Path" to allow travel.
Defeat "Marsh Adder" to complete the Quest.
Overcome "Find Your Friends" to unlock travel.
Overcome "Rescue Your Friends" to unlock travel.
Overcome "Escape the Spiders" to unlock travel.
Defeat "Ungoliant's Spawn" to complete the Quest.
Overcome "Follow the Stream" to advance immediately to Forest Stream OR overcome "Climb the Hill" to advance immediately to Bare Hilltop.
Overcome "Continue Downstream" to advance immediately to Mirkwood Swamp OR overcome "Search for a Path" to advance immediately to Overgrown Trail.
Overcome "Investigate the Smoke" to advance immediately to Abandoned Village OR overcome "Search for a Path" to advance immediately to Overgrown Trail.
Defeat "Giant Marsh Worm" to complete the Quest.
Overcome "Escape the Forest" to complete the Quest.
Defeat the last Enemy in play to complete the Quest.
Defeat the last Enemy in play to complete the Quest.
Overcome: Defeat all Enemies and Search the Area.
You have made it across the enchanted river. With its dark waters between you and your pursuers, you are free to continue your journey through Mirkwood Forest.
You have defeated Ungoliant's spawn and rescued your friends.

Against all odds, you have escaped from Mirkwood Forest and reached the vales of Anduin on the western end. The next leg of your journey will take you down the Anduin River to the land of the Beornings.
You have driven back your pursuers and are free to continue your journey downriver.
"That was fine work," exclaims Grimbeorn after the last Troll falls. Having rescued the Beorning's chieftain, at long last you can deliver King Brand's message and complete your mission.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.
Your journey has come to a tragic end.

"I am Aragorn son of Arathorn; and if by life or death I can save you, I will." -The Fellowship of the Ring
...thought and knowledge were in her glance, as of one who has known many things that the years bring. -The Fellowship of the Ring
"But no living man am I! You look upon a woman. Éowyn I am, Éomund's daughter." -The Return of the King
"The road may pass, but they shall not! Not while Faramir is Captain." -Mablung, The Two Towers
Frodo began to feel restless, and the old paths seemed too well-trodden. He looked at maps and wondered what lay beyond their edges... -The Fellowship of the Ring
"Men need many words before deeds. My axe is restless in my hands." -The Two Towers
"I can walk this path, but others have not this skill." -The Fellowship of the Ring
"I'm going with him... and if any of those Black Riders try to stop him, they'll have Sam Gamgee to reckon with." -The Fellowship of the Ring
"But spooks or no spooks, they won't get in The Prancing Pony so easy." -The Fellowship of the Ring
"I don't need your service, thank you... but I expect you need mine." -The Hobbit
"He gave me a look as plain as Mr. Pippin could speak it: if you don't let me go with you, Sam, I'll follow on my own." -Sam Gamgee, The Fellowship of the Ring
"...they say that you breathe so loud that they could shoot you in the dark." -Legolas, The Fellowship of the Ring
Down from the hills leaped Erkenbrand, lord of Westfold. -The Two Towers

Welcome to The Lord of the Rings Living Card Game!
Aragorn and Arwen are ambushed while traveling through Mirkwood Forest.
Aragorn and Arwen are Heroes. They begin the game in play. Heroes are powerful, but your journey will come to an end if they are all defeated.
This is an Enemy. You will encounter many of them during your adventures.
This is a Main Objective. Every Location has one. It tells you what you must do to move on to the next stage of your Quest.

The game is played in rounds, which have two phases: Planning and Adventure. Sauron goes first in each. On your turn in the Planning phase, you play cards to boost your Characters' abilities or prepare against Sauron.
To play a card, select and drag it to the play area. Play Mithrandir's Advice.

Playing a card requires spending Resources equal to the cost in its upper left corner. You get Resources at the start of each round, and by playing certain cards. Play Gaining Strength to get a Resource.
Allies help your Heroes. Play Guard of the Citadel to your player area.
You have played all the cards you can for now. Select the END PHASE button.

After you finish Planning, the
 Adventure phase begins.
 You take turns with Sauron
 during this phase, and may
 attack Enemies or
 engage Objectives.
In an attack, attacker and defender inflict damage on one another equal to their Attack values. Both Characters are then exhausted. A Character reduced to 0 Health is defeated.
Now it's your turn! Use Aragorn to attack the East Bight Patrol.
Aragorn's 2 Attack value drops the East Bight Patrol to 0 Health. The Enemy is defeated.

Once you overcome
 a Main Objective, you may
 travel to the next Location.
Select the TRAVEL button to continue your Quest.
This is the Threat meter. Your Threat increases at the end of each round and when you travel. If you reach 50 Threat, your Quest fails.
Aragorn and Arwen venture deeper into the forest.
Upkeep occurs at the start of each round. Some Characters have abilities that you may use at this time. Use Arwen's ability to heal Aragorn.
In addition to Enemies, Sauron can also play Attachments and Events. These cards have a variety of effects, from impeding your progress to damaging your Characters directly.
Some cards have keywords, which grant additional abilities. Play Horseback Archer, which has the Ranged keyword.
When making a ranged attack on an exhausted target, the attacker takes no damage. Use Horseback Archer to finish off the Hatchling Spider.
Use Aragorn to defeat the last Enemy.
Some cards have special Powers. Select Aragorn, then select his Power to spend 1 Resource and ready him.
You use Willpower to engage an Objective. Select Aragorn and drag him to Search the Area.
Your Characters are exhausted. Select the END PHASE button.
A new round has begun. Use Arwen's ability to heal one of your Characters.

A Character with the Sentinel
 keyword must be defeated before
 you can target other Enemies
 or Objectives.
You can use Attachments to enhance Characters. To equip an Attachment, play the card, then select a Hero or Ally. Equip Aragorn with the Warrior Sword.
Use what you've learned to defeat the Dol Guldur Orcs and Search the Area.

Excellent work!
 Now, finish off the Orcs to
 complete your Quest.
Excellent work! Now you can Search the Area to complete your Quest.

Congratulations! You have completed the tutorial, but that was merely the beginning. Create an Asmodee.net account now to unlock Heroes, Quests, and more. Here is all that you shall receive to start your own adventures in Middle-earth…
Campaign - including the first Quest free!
Welcome to The Lord of the Rings: Living Card Game! This tutorial will teach you the ins and outs of the game.
In this tutorial, Aragorn and Arwen are ambushed while traveling through Mirkwood Forest….
Greetings! I am Gandalf the Grey. I shall be your guide through this tutorial.
In The Lord of the Rings: Living Card Game, you take Heroes on a series of Quests. Each Quest leads you through many Locations across Middle-earth.
This banner shows your current Location.
The Location contains the Main Objective that you must resolve before your journey can continue. To view the Main Objective, select the Location banner.
You may close the Main Objective window at any time. Simply select the banner again.
This is your player area. Here you will find everything that you need during a Quest. Let's begin with the most important part…
Aragorn and Arwen are Heroes. They begin the game in play. Heroes are powerful, but your journey will come to an end if they are all defeated.
Heroes have certain abilities. The first is Attack value — the amount of damage dealt when you attack.
Next is Willpower. When engaging an Objective, you reduce its Quest value by this amount.
And this is Health. It indicates how much damage a Character can sustain before being defeated.
There is more to your Heroes than this, of course! Be patient; all shall be revealed soon.
This is your deck. You draw cards from it to perform various actions. You may select it at any time to see how many cards you have left. Go ahead; give it a try.
This meter shows your Resources, which you can spend to play cards and use abilities.
These are your Preparation sockets. They indicate whether you have readied a card with the Preparation trait. We shall talk more about those shortly.
Your hand holds the cards available for you to play. You start the game with five cards in hand, and draw one more during each Upkeep phase.
This is Sauron's area. Much like you, he has a deck, cards, Resources, and Preparation sockets.
This is also where you find the Threat meter. Your Threat increases at the end of each round and when you travel. If you reach 50 Threat, your Quest fails.
Let us not forget, Sauron has forces that oppose your Heroes. This is an Enemy. You will encounter many of them during your adventures.
Though similar to Heroes, Enemies have only Attack and Health values.
The game is played in rounds, which have three phases: Upkeep, Planning, and Adventure.
During Upkeep, you get 3 Resources and draw 1 card. Then Sauron does the same.
Next is the Planning phase. Sauron goes first here, and plays cards to oppose you.
On your turn in the Planning phase, you play cards to boost your Characters’ abilities or prepare against Sauron.
Your hand holds the cards available for you to play. You start the game with 5 cards, and draw 1 more during each Upkeep phase.
To examine a card in your hand, simply select it. Select Mithrandir's Advice.
To dismiss this view, select anywhere else on the board.
To play a card, select and drag it to the play area. Play Mithrandir’s Advice.
Playing a card requires spending Resources equal to the cost in its upper left corner. You get Resources at the start of each round, and by playing certain cards.
Play Gaining Strength to get a Resource.
Allies help your Heroes and have similar abilities — though they are not as powerful, of course.
To play an Ally, select and drag the card where you want the Ally to appear in your play area. Play Guard of the Citadel.
You have played all the cards you can, thus completing your Planning for now. Select the END PHASE button.
After you finish Planning, the Adventure phase begins. You take turns with Sauron during this phase, and may attack Enemies or engage Objectives.
In an attack, attacker and defender inflict damage on one another equal to their Attack values. Both Characters are then exhausted. A Character reduced to 0 Health is defeated.
You go first in the Adventure phase. Select Aragorn to attack one of the East Bight Patrol.
Since Aragorn’s 2 Attack value drops the East Bight Patrol to 0 Health, the Enemy is defeated.
Some cards have special Powers. Select Aragorn, then select his Power to spend 1 Resource and ready him.
Now you may use Aragorn to finish off the remaining Enemy.
Since you have resolved the Main Objective, you may travel to the next Location. Select the TRAVEL button to move on.
Remember, your Threat increases when you travel. Be careful, for Sauron gains additional powers when you reach certain Threat levels.
When traveling, you move to a new Location.
Aragorn and Arwen venture deeper into the forest….
A new round begins once we arrive at a new Location.
Some Characters have abilities that you may use during Upkeep. In this case, Arwen may restore 1 Health to a Character.
Select Aragorn to use Arwen's healing ability.
With that, the Planning phase begins, and Sauron acts.
In addition to Enemies, Sauron can also play Attachments and Events. These cards have a variety of effects, from impeding your progress to damaging your Characters directly.
Sauron defeated your Ally, but it is now your turn. Play Horseback Archer to replace your fallen Ally.
Thus ends the Planning phase. Select the END PHASE button to proceed.
As with the previous Location, your turn begins the Adventure phase. Use Aragorn to dispatch the East Bight Patrol.
Some cards have keywords, which grant additional abilities.
Horseback Archer has the Ranged keyword. This means he takes no damage when attacking an exhausted target.
Use Horseback Archer to finish off the Hatchling Spider.
Quests involve more than defeating vile creatures. You will also face many Objectives.
Each time you engage an Objective, you apply progress equal to your Willpower until it is resolved.
Select Aragorn, then select his Power to ready him.
Now drag Aragorn to Search the Area.
Your Characters are exhausted. Select the END ROUND button.
A new round has begun. Use Arwen’s ability to heal one of your Characters.
A Character with the Guard keyword must be defeated before you can target other Enemies or Objectives.
You can use Attachments to enhance Characters. To equip an Attachment, play the card, then select a Hero or Ally. Equip Aragorn with the Warrior Sword.
Use what you've learned to complete this Quest.
Now, finish off the Orcs to complete your Quest.
Now, finish searching the area to complete your Quest.
At the end of each Quest, you are scored based on how well you do. Performing particularly well can bestow Valor upon you, or even other rewards like Palantír Views.
Since this is merely a tutorial, there are no specific rewards — other than the pleasure of my company, of course!
Until next we meet, fare well wherever your adventures take you…
Congratulations! You have completed the tutorial, but that was merely the beginning.
Create an Asmodee.net account now to unlock Heroes, Quests, and more.
Here is all that you shall receive to start your own adventures in Middle-earth…

This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove. This is a placeholder text for exporting string over 255 characters so do not remove.
You take turns with Sauron during this phase, and may attack Enemies or engage Objectives.
A card type representing friends, followers, creatures, and hirelings that you can play to assist your Heroes on their Quest.
(Keyword) The attacker resolves damage before the target does. If this defeats the target, the attacker takes no damage.
(Trait) An Attachment type. A Character can have only one Attachment of each type at a time.
(Keyword) The ability triggers when the card enters play.
A card type representing armor, weapons, or special abilities. Unless otherwise stated, it modifies only the Character to which it is equipped.
A Character's effectiveness when attacking or defending in combat.
The icon shown in your profile.
(Keyword) Each time the Character takes damage, reduce the amount by 1.
A series of 5 Quests that tell a larger story.

The first time you log into the game every 24 hours, the game generates a challenge tied to a random unlocked Quest. You receive Valor (and potential additional rewards) for completing each daily challenge.
Achievements that are tracked over the lifetime of your account.
This card type refers to all Heroes and Allies. Enemies are also considered Characters.
Displayed in the upper-left corner, this is the number of Resources needed to play a card. Hero cards do not have a cost, since they begin the game in play.
A defeated Character is discarded. This can occur by falling to 0 Health or through some other means.
The challenge level you face in a Quest: Easy, Normal, or Hard. Sauron's Resources increase as the difficulty goes up, but you can gain greater rewards if you survive!
(Trait) One of the Dúnedain, the Man of the West.
The act of committing a Character to an Objective.
A card type that covers any scheme, twist of fate, or other effect that occurs during the game.
A card is exhausted when it is used. All exhausted cards ready during Upkeep.
An expendable card that you can use for an immediate in-game effect.
(Keyword) The card is discarded at the end of the round.
(Trait) A person from the most prominent kingdom of Men in Middle-earth.
(Keyword) The Character must be defeated before you can attack another Character or engage an Objective.
The amount of damage a Character can suffer before being defeated.
A main Character that you control during a Quest. Heroes start the game in play, and have a Threat value instead of a cost. If all your Heroes are defeated, you fail the Quest.
(Trait) One of a race of gentle beings with a reputation for preferring a settled life over excitement and adventure.
(Trait) An individual such as Gandalf or Saruman who is more than mortal and possessed of great age and power.
A Sphere of Influence representing the potential to lead, inspire, and command others.
A distinct Quest stage. Completing a Quest requires advancing through a series of Locations.
A Sphere of Influence emphasizing intellect, wisdom, and specialized knowledge.
(Trait) A person from the second clan of the Elves.
A task that you may face in the course of a Quest.
The primary goal you must resolve before you can advance to the next Location.
(Trait) A member of an evil and violent race who serve Sauron.
You can use the Palantír to gain rewards such as cards and Valor points.
During this phase, you and Sauron take turns playing cards prior to adventuring.
These are any Ally, Attachment, and Event cards you use throughout a Quest.
A deck of 30 cards based on 3 Heroes of your choice. You build each deck based on these Heroes, and you cannot have more than 2 copies of any individual card.
(Keyword) An ability that you may choose to activaate.
(Trait) An Event card type whose effect triggers based on a timing window or circumstance.
The amount by which you reduce an Objective's Quest points each time you apply Willpower.
(Keyword) The Character follows your Heroes from one Location to the next.
The value of an Objective. You use Willpower to resolve an Objective.
(Keyword) The Character does not take damage when attacking an exhausted target.
All player cards have a listed rarity: Starter and Hero, as well as Common, Uncommon, Rare, and Legendary. The less common a card is, the more potent its abilities.
The act of completing, overcoming, or otherwise removing an Objective.
A pool you can use on your turn to play cards from your deck. Resources refresh during Upkeep.
(Keyword) The ability triggers when the Character is defeated.
A person from the kingdom between the Misty Mountains and White Mountains.
(Trait) An Elf who is more interested in knowledge than in combat, compared to their Noldor cousins.
(Trait) An Attachment type. A Character can have only one Attachment of each type at a time.

Each of the four Spheres of Influence (Leadership, Lore, Spirit, Tactics) focuses on a particular personality aspect. Every Hero belongs to a Sphere, which dictates the cards you can include in a deck.
A Sphere of Influence encompassing strength of will and aspects of the supernatural.
(Keyword) The Character does not exhaust the first time it is attacked.
(Keyword) The Character cannot be attacked unless all of your non-Stealth Characters are exhausted.
(Keyword) The Character does not exhaust the first time it takes an action.
A Sphere of Influence emphasizing martial prowess, from tactical challenges to direct combat.
The general term for a card that is the object of an action.
This tracks the level of risk you take during a Quest. Your Threat increases at the end of each round and when you travel. If you reach 50 Threat, you fail the Quest.
This number applies from each Hero to the Threat meter at the start of the Quest.
Some cards have traits which indicate certain behavior or restrictions.
At the start of each round, your cards ready, you gain Resources, and you draw 1 card from your deck; Sauron then does the same. Certain abilities may also activate at this time.
In-game rewards that you can spend to get Quests, Heroes, cards, avatars, and more.
(Keyword) The ability triggers when this card defeats another.
(Trait) An Attachment type. A Character can have only one Attachment of each type at a time.
A Character's effectiveness when engaging an Objective.
